o: Reusable building blocks that encapsulate HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

q: What file extension do Svelte components use?
Svelte components use the _____ file extension.
What are the three sections of a Svelte component?
A Svelte component contains script, style, and _____ sections.
Are all three sections required in a Svelte component?
What is the purpose of the script section?
o: Contains JavaScript logic, variables, and imports

q: How do you import a child component?
Components are imported using ES _____ syntax.

o: Data passed from parent to child components

q: Props pass data from _____ to child components.
How do you declare a prop in a child component?
How do you pass a prop to a child component?
o: Using attributes on the component tag

q: What is the prop shorthand syntax?
How do you set a default value for a prop?
o: Assign a value when declaring the prop

q: Default prop values are set by _____ during declaration.
Can you mutate props in a child component?
o: Yes, but changes won't propagate to parent

q: Prop mutations in child do not _____ to parent.

o: Placeholders for content passed from parent to child

q: Slots allow passing _____ from parent to child.
How do you define a slot in a child component?
Slots are defined using the <_____> element.
How do you pass content to a slot?
o: Place content between component opening and closing tags

q: Slot content is placed _____ the component tags.

o: Default content shown when slot is empty

q: Fallback content shows when slot is _____.

o: Slots with specific names to target content placement

q: How do you place content in a named slot?
o: Using slot="name" attribute on the content

q: Content targets named slots using slot=_____ attribute.
Match slot types with their usage:

o: Data passed from child slot back to parent content

q: Slot props pass data from child _____ to parent content.
How do you access slot props in the parent?

o: A wrapper to group slot content without adding DOM elements

q: svelte:fragment groups content without adding _____ elements.

o: When you need to place multiple elements in a named slot

q: svelte:fragment is useful for _____ elements in named slots.

o: Object indicating which slots have content provided

q: How do you check if a slot has content?
o: Using $$slots.slotName which is true if content exists

q: $$slots.header is _____ if header slot has content.
Rearrange the slot content rendering process:

o: Custom events dispatched from child to parent

q: Component events flow from _____ to parent.
How do you create an event dispatcher?
c:
<script>
  import { createEventDispatcher } from 'svelte';
  const dispatch = createEventDispatcher();
</script>

q: How do you dispatch an event?
c:
<script>
  import { createEventDispatcher } from 'svelte';
  const dispatch = createEventDispatcher();
  
  function handleClick() {
    dispatch('select', { id: 1 });
  }
</script>

q: How does the parent listen to child events?
Where is the event data available?
Event data is accessed via event._____.

o: Passing events through to parent without handling

q: How do you forward a DOM event?

o: Yes, same syntax as DOM events

q: Component events can be forwarded using on:_____ syntax.

o: A way to pass data down the component tree without props

c:
<script>
  import { getContext } from 'svelte';
  const user = getContext('user');
</script>

o: No, but you can pass a store as context value

q: To make context reactive, pass a _____ as value.
What is a good practice for context keys?
o: Use symbols or objects to avoid naming collisions

q: Symbols as context keys avoid naming _____.

o: Object containing all props passed to component
For spreading all props to child elements

q: $$props is useful for _____ props to children.

o: Object containing props not explicitly exported

q: What is the difference between $$props and $$restProps?
o: $$props has all props, $$restProps excludes declared exports

q: Rearrange the component communication methods by scope:

o: Building complex UIs by combining smaller components

q: What is the benefit of component composition?
o: Reusability, maintainability, and separation of concerns

q: Composition promotes _____ and separation of concerns.

o: Hiding internal implementation details from parent
Component that manages data and logic, passing to children
Component focused on UI display, receiving data via props
Component that enhances or modifies child behavior
Passing props through multiple levels of components

q: Prop drilling passes data through _____ levels.
What is the problem with prop drilling?
o: Components become tightly coupled and harder to maintain

q: Prop drilling causes _____ coupling between components.
How do you avoid prop drilling?
Context and stores help avoid prop _____.
Match communication patterns with use cases:
What is two-way binding with props?
o: Syncing a prop value between parent and child

q: How does bind:this work with components?
o: Gets a reference to the component instance

q: bind:this on a component returns the component _____.
What can you do with a component reference?
c:
<script>
  let child;
  function callChildMethod() {
    child.doSomething();
  }
</script>

<Child bind:this={child} />
o: Call exported functions and access exported variables

q: How do you export a function from a component?

c:
<script>
  import ComponentA from './A.svelte';
  import ComponentB from './B.svelte';
  let current = ComponentA;
</script>

<svelte:component this={current} />
o: Rendering different components based on a variable

q: What happens when svelte:component this is null?
svelte:component renders nothing when this is _____.
Can you pass props to svelte:component?

o: A component that renders itself for nested data

q: Recursive components render _____ for nested data.
How do you create a recursive component?
c:
{node.name}
{#if node.children} {#each node.children as child} {/each} {/if}
o: Using svelte:self to reference the current component
Rendering tree structures like file browsers or menus

q: What is the render prop pattern?
o: Using slot props to pass render logic from parent

q: Render props use _____ to pass data for rendering.
What is the compound component pattern?
o: Related components sharing implicit state through context

q: What are the benefits of compound components?
o: Flexible API with implicit state sharing
Through shared context values and stores
A component that provides context to its descendants

q: Match component patterns with their benefits:
Lazy loading loads components only when _____.
How do you lazy load a component?
o: Using dynamic import with await block

q: Dynamic imports are used with _____ blocks for lazy loading.

o: Reduces initial bundle size and improves load time
A function that takes a component and returns enhanced component
No, Svelte prefers composition and actions

q: What is component typing with TypeScript?
c:
<script lang="ts">
  export let name: string;
  export let age: number = 0;
</script>
o: Adding type annotations to component props and state

q: How do you type component events?
c:
<script lang="ts">
  import { createEventDispatcher } from 'svelte';
  const dispatch = createEventDispatcher<{
    select: { id: number };
  }>();
</script>
o: Using generic type parameter with dispatch types

q: Match TypeScript features with Svelte usage:

o: Checking that props meet expected requirements

q: Prop validation checks that props meet _____.
How do you validate props at runtime?
c:
<script>
  export let value;
  
  $: if (typeof value !== 'number') {
    throw new Error('value must be a number');
  }
</script>
o: Using reactive statements with type checks

q: What is CSS scoping in components?
o: Styles only apply to the component they're defined in
By adding unique class attributes to elements

o: Group by feature and keep components small and focused

Comments and examples explaining component usage

q: What tools help document Svelte components?

o: Making components usable by people with disabilities

o: role, aria-label, aria-expanded, aria-controls as needed

q: How do you handle keyboard navigation in components?

q: What is focus management in components?
o: Controlling where keyboard focus goes during interactions

q: When should you move focus programmatically?
o: When opening modals, showing notifications, or after actions

q: Focus is moved programmatically when opening _____.
How do you move focus in Svelte?
c:
<script>
  let inputElement;
  function focusInput() {
    inputElement.focus();
  }
</script>

<input bind:this={inputElement} />
o: Using bind:this and calling focus() method

q: Elements are focused using the _____() method.

o: Keeping focus within a container like a modal

q: Focus traps keep focus within a _____.

o: Verifying components work correctly in isolation

q: How do you test props in Svelte components?

q: Props are passed to render via _____ object.

q: Events are tested using $_____ to attach handlers.

q: Slots are tested by passing content in _____ option.

o: Replacing child components with simplified versions

q: How do you mock a child component?
o: Using vi.mock or jest.mock to replace imports

q: Component mocks use vi._____ or jest._____.

o: Props for inputs, events for outputs, minimal side effects

q: What is snapshot testing for components?
o: Comparing rendered output against saved reference

q: When should you use snapshot testing?
o: For detecting unintended changes to component output

q: What are the drawbacks of snapshots?
o: Can become outdated and may not test behavior
Improving component render speed and efficiency
Number of updates, DOM size, computation complexity

q: How do you prevent unnecessary re-renders?
o: Only update state when values actually change

q: Re-renders are prevented by checking if values _____.
What is key prop in each blocks?

q: What happens without keys in lists?
o: Svelte updates by index which can cause issues with state
Unique and stable identifier like database ID
Styles automatically limited to the component

q: Svelte styles are _____ limited to the component.

o: Adds unique class hash to selectors and elements

q: Can scoped styles affect child components?
o: No, by default they only affect the component's own elements

q: How do you style child component elements?

o: Passing CSS variables directly to components

q: CSS props are passed using _____ prefix.

q: Svelte wraps components in _____ for CSS props.

o: Customizing component appearance using CSS variables

q: How do you create a themeable component?

o: Named values for colors, spacing, typography, etc.

q: Design tokens are _____ values for styles.

Major versions are bumped for _____ changes.

o: Marking components as outdated with migration path

q: How do you deprecate a component?
o: Add JSDoc @deprecated tag with migration guide
Package of reusable components for distribution

q: How do you structure a component library?
o: Components folder with index.js exports and package.json
SvelteKit tool for building distributable component packages

o: Build with svelte-package, then npm publish

o: Component that can render as different HTML elements
Dynamic element that renders different HTML tags
Creating flexible components like Button that can be a or button

q: Polymorphic Button can render as button or _____.

o: Keeping state as close as possible to where it's used
Improves component reusability and reduces coupling
Moving state to a common ancestor when shared between components
When multiple components need to share the same state

q: State is lifted when multiple components need to _____.

o: Hiding implementation complexity behind simple interface
Clear APIs with minimal coupling to internals
When internal implementation details leak through the API
Designing props, events, and slots for usability

o: No, keep props focused and use composition
Using same naming and behavior patterns across components

{#if error}

Error: {error.message}

{:else} {/if}

o: Attaching event handlers to server-rendered HTML

Only hydrating interactive components, not static ones
Static HTML with isolated interactive component islands

More flexible, easier to understand, avoids inheritance pitfalls

q: What is component inversion of control?
o: Child component controls its content via slots and props
Component providing logic without rendering UI

q: How do you create a headless component?
c:
<script>
  export let items = [];
  let selectedIndex = 0;
  
  function next() { selectedIndex++; }
  function prev() { selectedIndex--; }
</script>

<slot {items} {selectedIndex} {next} {prev} />
o: Expose logic via slot props, let parent render UI
Same as headless - provides behavior without rendering

q: Renderless is another term for _____ components.

o: Wrapping component to change its interface
When integrating third-party components with different API
Wrapper that adds behavior to component
Component that controls access to another component
Function that creates configured component instances
Central place to register and lookup components
Loading components from different build outputs at runtime

q: Module federation loads components from different _____.

o: Breaking frontend into independently deployable pieces
Managing component state through defined states and transitions
Complex UI with many states like forms, wizards, players

q: State machines help with _____ UI logic.
What library helps with state machines in Svelte?
_____ is popular library for state machines.

o: Function that updates state based on action type

q: How do you implement reducer in Svelte?
c:
<script>
  function reducer(state, action) {
    switch (action.type) {
      case 'increment': return { count: state.count + 1 };
      case 'decrement': return { count: state.count - 1 };
    }
  }
  
  let state = { count: 0 };
  function dispatch(action) { state = reducer(state, action); }
</script>
o: Using pure function that returns new state based on action

q: What is command pattern in components?
o: Encapsulating actions as objects for undo/redo

q: What is observer pattern in components?
o: Components subscribing to changes in data

q: What is mediator pattern in components?
o: Central component coordinating communication between others
When many components need to communicate without tight coupling
Caching computation results to avoid recalculating
For expensive computations with same inputs

q: How do you memoize in Svelte?
c:
<script>
  import { derived } from 'svelte/store';
  
  // Or use reactive declaration
  $: expensive = computeExpensive(input);
</script>
o: Using reactive declarations or derived stores
Delaying action until input stops for specified time
Search input, form validation, resize handlers
Limiting how often a function can execute
Scroll handlers, mouse move, window resize

q: What is the difference between debounce and throttle?
o: Debounce waits for pause, throttle executes at intervals

q: Debounce waits for _____, throttle limits rate.

o: Only rendering visible items in long lists

q: When should you use virtual scrolling?
o: Lists with hundreds or thousands of items

q: What library helps with virtual scrolling in Svelte?

o: Loading more items as user scrolls to bottom

q: How do you detect scroll near bottom?
c:
<script>
  function handleScroll(e) {
    const { scrollTop, scrollHeight, clientHeight } = e.target;
    if (scrollTop + clientHeight >= scrollHeight - 50) {
      loadMore();
    }
  }
</script>
o: Check if scrollTop + clientHeight >= scrollHeight - threshold

q: Scroll detection uses scrollTop, clientHeight, and _____.

o: Dividing bundle into chunks loaded on demand

q: Code splitting creates chunks loaded on _____.

c:
// Dynamic import creates split point
const Component = () => import('./Heavy.svelte');
o: Dynamic imports create separate chunks bundlers load lazily
Removing unused code from final bundle
On hover, focus, or viewport intersection

o: Generating static HTML at build time

o: Time until largest visible element is rendered

q: CLS is caused by elements _____ after render.

o: Reserve space for dynamic content with explicit dimensions
